intro: Cryptotheca, commonly known as the "ghost flower," is a genus of flowering plants in the family Scrophulariaceae. It is characterized by its unique, often pale or translucent flowers that appear to be almost invisible against certain backgrounds. The plants typically grow in arid or semi-arid regions, thriving in rocky soils and dry environments. Cryptotheca species are known for their small, delicate leaves and their ability to withstand harsh climatic conditions. These plants are of interest to botanists due to their specialized adaptations and ecological significance in their native habitats.
